WFF]JpG]{X@Fj|aYE?1b.text: Ghosts Modes:-1 = Inactive0 = Chase1 = Scatter2 = Freightened

.ZYBv5C2QxZ(sK^kkd7i.text: NOTE: Some of these script blocks are insanely long intentionally. It's done for performance. Broadcasts fork the code and are too expensive.There are a lot of variables for a few reasons:1) Many of the variables are used to tweak timing and gameplay during development. It's easier to change a value in one place, usually at the top of scripts.2) Variables reduce the number of "magic" numbers in code. This means the variables themselves help to document what's going on.  If the variable names are descriptive enough, they self-document. I could have done a better job.3) Since the code is not very modular and reuse is at a minimum, there's a lot of state to maintain in variables. :( It's in the name of performance usually.4) The priority for the game is to closely resemble the original game, perform well, be playable, and not take up the rest of my life to develop. Code quality probably suffers as a result and I'm not planning on refactoring for maintenance sake. Someone can remix for that reason if they like.

iHIneA{,fC~H_mt0vA*j.text: To allow ms pacman to move through the portals, we need to keep resetting the detected position to the grid's limit. Ms Pacman will still be allowed to move past the grid's limits since she'll be sitting on the specialized tile of 2.

Vvz{XGD!10MZ%|z|fB/%.text:
this is how we'll track individual ghosts  being scared or not

2 is frightened
0 is normal(chased)

when a dot is eaten, if eyes are not 0, then that ghost was just eaten and is on its way home. we can't change it back to blue unless it's at home or on it's way out, or out

F0*z,p]{DrODg{0D+ZJ8.text:
The long script block that handles the "Blinky Service Loop" broadcast can crash Scratch.

TIPS TO AVOID CRASHING SCRATCH IDE

Apply these tips while on the Ghosts' Scripts tab.

- Do not drag the scrollbar. Click the empty part of the scrollbar to scroll a page at a time.
- Pause a few seconds between clicks, especially on the scrollbar.
- Drag blocks SLOWLY and wait until Scratch responds before dragging long distances.
- MOST IMPORANT: break the large "Service Loop" script block up into 2 or more pieces, make your changes, then put the block back together.
- SAVE OFTEN
- Avoid scrolling upwards. It's better to save and let Scratch reset you to the top of the page or to click onto another sprite and then back onto this one.
- Avoid editing text fields on blocks that are part of large script blocks. Try breaking the block out, make your edit, and then reattach it.

BROADCAST_INPUT: Inky Head Out of Monster Pen
broadcastMsgId-inky head out of monster pen
Inky Head Out of Monster Pen

BROADCAST_OPTION: Inky Head Out of Monster Pen
